notes.text:
A vulnerability in affected devices could allow an attacker to perform a denial of service attack if a large amount of specially crafted UDP packets are sent to the device.

Siemens has released new versions for several affected products and recommends to update to the latest versions. Siemens recommends specific countermeasures for products where fixes are not, or not yet available.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text:
As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends to protect network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. In order to operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends to configure the environment according to Siemens' operational guidelines for Industrial Security (Download: 
https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-security), and to follow the recommendations in the product manuals.
Additional information on Industrial Security by Siemens can be found at: https://www.siemens.com/industrialsecurity
notes.title: General Recommendations

notes.text: For further inquiries on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and solutions, please contact the Siemens ProductCERT: https://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories
notes.title: Additional Resources

notes.text: Siemens Security Advisories are subject to the terms and conditions contained in Siemens' underlying license terms or other applicable agreements previously agreed to with Siemens (hereinafter "License Terms"). To the extent applicable to information, software or documentation made available in or through a Siemens Security Advisory, the Terms of Use of Siemens' Global Website (https://www.siemens.com/terms_of_use, hereinafter "Terms of Use"), in particular Sections 8-10 of the Terms of Use, shall apply additionally. In case of conflicts, the License Terms shall prevail over the Terms of Use.
notes.title: Terms of Use

revision_history.summary: Added solution for SINAMICS S120 V4.7, SINAMICS S150, SINAMICS G130 V4.7, SINAMICS G150 and SINAMICS SL150 V4.7
Added solution for SIMATIC S7-1200 and S7-1500 Software and Open Controller. SIPLUS devices now explicitly mentioned in the list of affected products
Added solution for SIMATIC S7-300 CPU family
Added solution for SIMATIC ET200MP IM155-5 PN HF
Added SIMATIC TDC CP51M1 and CPU555 to the list of affected products
Added solution for SIMATIC PN/PN Coupler. Added SIMATIC ET200ecoPN product variants (MLFB IDs) that are not affected
Added solution for EK-ERTEC 200P and S7-410 V8
Added solution for SIMATIC ET200SP IM155-6 PN HA and added ecoPN model (6ES7148-6JG00-0BB0) as not affected
Added solution for SIMATIC ET200SP IM155-6 PN HS
Clarified that no remediation is planned for ET200 devices
No fix planned for SIMATIC S7-400 PN/DP V6 and below CPU family

Added fix for SINUMERK 840D sl; no fix planned for PROFINET development/evaluation kits - DK Standard Ethernet Controller and EK-ERTEC 200; SIMATIC S7-300 CPU family expanded with product specific designations, patch links and MLFBs
No fix planned for remaining products
Expanded SIMATIC S7-400 V7 CPU family (incl. SIPLUS variants) to individual products and MLFBs; added fix for SIMATIC S7-400 PN/DP V7 CPUs; clarified that other S7-400 V7 CPUs are not affected
Listed affected products individually instead of product families (e.g., for SIMATIC ET 200AL/MP/SP/pro IM families); added affected SIPLUS devices (e.g., SIPLUS ET 200xx IM)

notes.text:
Affected devices improperly handle large amounts of specially crafted UDP packets.

This could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to trigger a denial of service condition.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Restrict network access to affected devices
Currently no fix is planned
